lcInstruction.p: Use the <parml> (parameter list) element when you need to document a list of arguments for a function or API parameters. Some style guides call for the <parml> element to be contained within a separate <section> element, while others might put them in the <refsyn> element. The <parml> element is a specialization of the <dl> (definition list) element, and contains a list of parameters and their use within a program.
The <parml> element contains one or more <plentry> (parameter list entry) elements, which contains one or more <pt> (parameter term) and <pd> (parameter definition) elements.

step.cmd: After the <codeblock> element, add a <parml> element and add two <plentry> elements.
